greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (1 - (-5)^n)/6.
comment: Let A be the Hessenberg matrix of order n, defined by: A[1,j]=1, A[i,i]:=-5, (i>1), A[i,i-1]=-1, and A[i,j]=0 otherwise. Then, for n>=1, a(n)=det(A). - _Milan Janjic_, Jan 27 2010
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-4,5).
maple: a:=n->sum ((-5)^j, j=0..n): seq(a(n), n=0..25); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Dec 16 2008
program: (Sage) [gaussian_binomial(n,1,-5) for n in range(1,22)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 28 2009
(MAGMA) I:=[1, -4]; [n le 2 select I[n] else -4*Self(n-1)+5*Self(n-2): n in [1..30]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 19 2012
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
